channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Lockdown was 'less effective in BAME communities', University of Leicester study finds
item.description: Researchers found BAME Covid-19 cases continued to rise in Leicester in March in the three weeks after the country went into lockdown, while rates in white groups dropped off 'very sharply'

item.title: Inferno engulfs Nantes cathedral as 60 firefighters battle to save 1434 church
item.description: Prosecutor Pierre Sennes told reporters three fires had been started at the site in Nantes and authorities were treating the incident as a criminal act. He gave no other details.

item.title: 'I'm still Captain Tom... not SIR Tom': Fundraising hero brushes off honorary title
item.description: 'I'm still Captain Tom,' he said on today's BBC Breakfast. 'I think that's the easy one. People will be able to remember, so just straight forward Captain Tom, or if we get a bit closer, just Tom.'

item.title: Lycra-clad cyclist is filmed screaming shocking rant at pregnant driver who beeped at him
item.description: An angry cyclist launched into a tirade at a pregnant woman after he was accused of breaching the Highway Code by cycling two abreast 'in the middle' of a road in Cleethorpes, Grimsby.

item.title: Russia claims to have signed Covid-19 vaccine deal with Oxford University
item.description: Kirill Dmitriev, head of Russia's sovereign wealth fund, pictured right said Moscow has signed a deal to produce a Covid-19 vaccine with Oxford University.

item.title: Sheepish father of the bride Prince Andrew is spotted 25 hours after Princess Beatrice's wedding
item.description: The shamed royal looked abashed as he drove off the grounds of Windsor in a black Range Rover just after attending the first 'secret' royal wedding for 234 years.

item.title: 'Please don't let me die': Last words of graduate, 24, after 40ft fall while escaping burning car
item.description: Azra Kemal, 24, slipped through a 10ft wide void between two carriageways on a road bridge on the A21 between Sevenoaks and Tonbridge on Thursday.

item.title: Princess Beatrice's new husband's ex Dara Huang is seen enjoying drinks out on the town
item.description: Princess Beatrice's new husband's ex Dara Huang was seen enjoying an evening out on the town just hours after Edo Mapelli Mozzi married the royal in a secret ceremony at Windsor Castle.

item.title: Two men are stabbed in London's financial district as post-lockdown violence explodes in capital
item.description: A spate of unrelated shootings and stabbings has rocked London over the past two weeks as the UK steps out of lockdown, causing police to step up patrols.

item.title: Prince Andrew's blamed for first secret royal wedding for 235 years as daughter Beatrice gets wed
item.description: Prince Andrew walked his daughter Beatrice down the aisle on Friday in the first 'secret' royal wedding for 235 years. Beatrice, 31, wed her fiance Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi on the Windsor estate.

item.title: Incredible moment daring skateboarder jumps off an 11-foot-tall Sydney bus in amazing TikTok stunt
item.description: Video shows the skateboarder ride across the bus and jump onto a glass shelter just before the bus drives off on one of Sydney's busiest streets.

item.title: Ministers told UK was on brink of running out of food after Macron warned he would close borders
item.description: It is claimed Health Secretary Matt Hancock was told at the start of the Covid-19 crisis the UK's food supply chain was about to 'fall over' as workers at French ports failed to turn up.

item.title: Beaches and parks brace for onslaught of visitors as London and the south is set for 82F sun today
item.description: The Met Office forecast a split in temperatures between the two regions with a 'fairly grey' day for northern England and north Wales but scorching conditions in the south-east.

item.title: Scientists line up to blast Boris Johnson's aim of a return to pre-pandemic life by Christmas
item.description: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps told BBC Breakfast this morning: 'We want to give people some sense of direction, because a lot of people are running businesses.'

item.title: Masseuse tells of session with 'chatty' Prince Andrew on Jeffrey Epstein's 'Paedophile Island'
item.description: Masseuse Heidi Windel, now 75, has claimed to have given several non-sexual massages to Prince Andrew when she was working on Jeffrey Epstein's Caribbean island from 1999 until 2004.

item.title: Why it's us parents are to blame for the age of the narcissists says Dominic Sanbrook
item.description: RICHARD SAMBROOK: Today, when we live in an age of children's crusades, this story feels unsettlingly resonant. We, too, are fixated with saints, such as the Swedish teenager Greta Thunberg.

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Robin Birley forks out £500 to each member of his Mayfair nightspots
item.description: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: I can reveal that 'king of clubs' Robin Birley has taken the extraordinary step of spending millions of his own money to lure members back to his Mayfair nightspots.

item.title: Home of Daily Mail columnist Nigel Dempster is for sale for £4.25million
item.description: The home of Nigel Dempster - who was best known for his celebrity gossip column in the Daily Mail - is on the market for £4.25m via Savills estate agents.

item.title: Just SEVEN PER CENT of crimes end with a suspect in court
item.description: The proportion of crimes in England and Wales resulting in a charge or summons have declined from 15.15 per cent in the year to March 2015 to seven per cent in the 12 months to March.

item.title: LAPD officer known for prize-winning shooting skills now at the center of a deadly shooting
item.description: LAPD police officer Toni McBride, 23, shot and killed Daniel Hernandez, 38, in downtown LA in April after he walked towards her with a knife. She is now being sued by the man's daughter.

item.title: Personal assistant, 21, is led away in handcuffs on murder charge in dismemberment case
item.description: Tyrese Devon Haspil, 21, was arrested and charged with second degree murder on Friday over the grisly murder of his 33-year-old boss in his Lower East Side apartment earlier this week.

item.title: 50-mile swarm of flying ants heads for Kent and Sussex
item.description: The plague of insects peppered the skies over Kent and Sussex on their so-called 'nuptial flight', an event triggered by the mini-heatwave which has hit the nation.

item.title: Is it worth buying a home on a holiday park?
item.description: The phones started ringing in June and they haven't stopped. Homeowners at Britain's top holiday parks are seeing bookings hit record levels this summer as the pandemic has led to curbs on foreign travel.

item.title: The sexual betrayals, secret fraud and deceit behind the murder attempt that transfixed Britain
item.description: On Easter Sunday 2015, Victoria Cilliers survived falling 4,000ft at Netheravon airfield, Wiltshire, after her main and reserve parachute failed to open correctly.

item.title: Florist to the Royals provides a glimpse behind the scenes at Princess Beatrice's secret wedding
item.description: Martyn Crossley has supplied flowers to the Royal Family for many years and even created a wreath for the Queen to place on her mother's grave.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's 'husband' Scott Borgerson talked up dating high profile woman but not identity
item.description: The man who is rumored to be Ghislaine Maxwell's husband, Scott Borgerson, is said to have told his parents he was dating a 'high profile woman'. The pair recently lived together in New Hampshire.

item.title: Riot police fend off barrage of bricks and bottles in battle to shut down illegal rave in London
item.description: Last night's illegal rave in London comes amid fears from the Government's scientific advisory group that the coronavirus Rate rate has crept above one in the capital again.

item.title: Millions of children likely to stay home in the fall
item.description: Millions more children learned on Friday that they are unlikely to return to classrooms full time in autumn because of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Twitter hack was orchestrated by group of young pals
item.description: Cybersecurity experts were stunned by the startling revelation that Wednesday's breach, unprecedented in scale for the social media site, seemingly amounted to youthful hijinks.

item.title: Union boss's early retirement sparks fears his replacement may undermine Sir Keir Starmer
item.description: Unite's Len McCluskey, a leading ally of Jeremy Corbyn, has triggered an election for a new general secretary after announcing his retirement a year before his term in office was due to end

item.title: Queen knights Captain Sir Tom Moore at Windsor Castle
item.description: The unprecedented personal ceremony for fundraising hero Captain Sir Tom Moore was staged in Windsor Castle's quadrangle this afternoon.

item.title: Civil rights icon John Lewis dies at 80
item.description: Civil rights icon John Lewis has died at the age of 80 after a long battle with pancreatic cancer.

item.title: Trump will not require Americans to wear masks because he 'wants people to have a certain freedom'
item.description: President Donald Trump in an upcoming interview said he won't require all Americans to wear face masks and shot criticism back at Dr. Anthony Fauci for mixed messaging on facial coverings.

item.title: Leeds United fans celebrate Premier League return in streets - despite club's pleas to stay home
item.description: Leeds United fans celebrated promotion to the Premier League tonight outside Elland Road in party scenes, ignoring advice from the club itself to stay home

item.title: Boris Johnson will give former England cricket captain Sir Ian Botham a peerage this month
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson plans to reward Brexiteers, including cricketer Sir Ian Botham, with peerages on the anniversary of Mr Johnson arriving at Downing Street

item.title: Andrew Sullivan writes final column for New York magazine
item.description: Conservative columnist Andrew Sullivan has revealed he is leaving New York magazine because he misses writing freely without being in a 'defensive crouch'.

item.title: Mother-of-five who gave birth to QUADRUPLETS shows off her incredible transformation
item.description: Michelle Zamora, 31, was given a mommy makeover on Netflix's new series Skin Decision: Before and After, starring Dr. Sheila Nazarian and 'Nurse Jamie' Sherrill.

item.title: JOHN HUMPHRYS: Faced with today's China, our aircraft carriers are as useful as a terracotta army
item.description: JOHN HUMPHRYS: Sadly, it is far too late to reverse the ludicrous decision that led to us wasting so many billions on aircraft carriers we did not need and which have proved technically hopeless.

item.title: Dustin Honken executed by lethal injection for 1993 murders
item.description: Dustin Lee Honken, 52, was put to death by lethal injection in Terre Haute penitentiary, Indiana, Friday afternoon.

item.title: EU leaders will meet again today to try to save €1.9trillion budget and coronavirus recovery fund
item.description: The marathon of talks will continue from 11am today after the Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte dug his heels in on Friday over a plan to help struggling southern countries including Spain and Italy.

item.title: Westminster Abbey bells won't ring for Meghan Markle birthday
item.description: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: I hear that Westminster Abbey will not ring its bells for Meghan Markle's birthday next month. To add insult to injury, it did ring them for the birthday of Prince Andrew.

item.title: What's in store for Britain? Casinos and bowling alleys to open within a fortnight
item.description: The UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson yesterday set out an optimistic vision to ditch social distancing rules as soon as November. His top scientists poured cold water on the idea.

item.title: What an example! Just one in five civil servants have returned to the office
item.description: Boris Johnson yesterday urged employees to stop working from home in a bid to get the economy moving again. But in some Whitehall departments barely 10 per cent of staff are back at their desks.

item.title: Coronavirus has already slashed life expectancy by TWO YEARS
item.description: Life expectancy in England and Wales had been steadily improving for the last 50 years but the nearly 53,000 excess deaths caused by coronavirus has put it back to 2008 levels.

item.title: Yes, the sun IS deadly - and here's my cancer scar to prove it, says JANET STREET-PORTER
item.description: JANET STREET-PORTER: Honestly, I am not a particularly vain person, which is a good thing because I now have a scar running right down my nose. Yes, slap bang in the middle of my face.

item.title: Story of Rockfield Studios where rock legends like Oasis, Black Sabbath and Queen wrote hit music
item.description: Ahead of a BBC documentary about the history of the infamous Rockfield Studios, owner Kingsley Ward speaks with the Daily Mail about it's storied history with tales on Queen and Oasis

item.title: Manchester Arena bomber seen by worried bystander before attack
item.description: Manchester Arena bomber Salman Abedi was spotted by a worried member of the public who alerted security minutes before he killed 22 people in his suicide attack, new evidence revealed.

item.title: Family pay tribute to 'beloved son' killed in Westminster stabbing as police arrest two for murder
item.description: The family of Ahmed Yasin-Ali, 18, who was killed in Westminster earlier this week have paid tribute to their 'beloved son' as police officers arrest man, 23, and boy, 17 on suspicion of murder

item.title: How Britain teaches China to conquer the West: UK's top universities share research with China
item.description: As relations between the West and China plummet, we can at least take comfort from the fact that many of our leading academic institutions still enjoy a healthy collaboration with China.

item.title: Sailors told to stop using male-themed Navy terms like 'unmanned' and 'man power'
item.description: Sources said there was an acceptance within the force that some terms are no longer appropriate and considered problematic and that leaders wanted to get rid of gendered terms where possible.

item.title: How Beatrice's beau Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi is a suave millionaire with a rather tangled private life
item.description: Edo Mapelli Mozzi, pictured with his former partner Dara Huang, right, and their child Wolfie Mapelli Mozzi. Dara remains a part of Edo's life and even helps him pick out clothes.

item.title: Scientists identify six different 'types' of Covid-19 each based on 'cluster of symptoms'
item.description: Data gathered by King's College London's Covid Symptom Study app was used to predict which patients will require hospitalisation based on their early symptoms.

item.title: DR MAX THE MIND DOCTOR: Why we rebels must heed the rules on masks
item.description: DR MAX THE MIND DOCTOR: Feeling hot and sweaty. Failing to make yourself understood. Can't hear what people are saying. Unable to see their faces. Welcome to the world of face masks!

item.title: Surge in dog thefts as organised gangs take advantage of soaring prices during lockdown
item.description: Dog thefts have soared as criminal gangs swoop for pets amid a surge in prices during lockdown. Demand for certain breeds has risen after families looked for a distraction during lockdown.

item.title: How Johnny Depp blew his half billion bounty: Star bought £25,000 of wine every month
item.description: Did Depp blow hundreds of millions, due to what some associates dub a 'compulsive spending disorder?' Or is someone else to blame for his financial downfall?

item.title: You WILL get a refund if your holiday firm goes bust after Government promises money-back guarantee
item.description: The move is designed to boost confidence in booking package holidays at a time when many tour firms fear for their future.

item.title: Government plans £200m boost for houses of 5,000 military personnel and their families
item.description: The government has announced plans to modernise thousands of homes of military personnel and their families as well as making them more environmentally friendly

item.title: Jihadi bride Shamima Begum delighted to be allowed home to UK
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The 20-year-old, who fled London to join ISIS, is nervous about the reception she will receive but has been 'very happy' since hearing the news yesterday.

item.title: AMANDA PLATELL: Shamima Begum was brainwashed as a child and should now be brought back to Britain
item.description: AMANDA PLATELL: No one was more horrified than me on learning that a 15-year-old born and raised in London, a 'talented and dynamic' student, had fled to Syria to become a jihadi bride.

item.title: 'Game-changing' antibody test that takes 20 minutes passes first trials with 98.6% accuracy
item.description: A 'game-changing' antibody test for coronavirus that takes just 20 minutes is reported to have passed its first major government trials with highly promising results.

item.title: Adorable 'Paddington Bear' cubs play fight at Chester Zoo
item.description: The same breed as Paddington, Michael Bond's character from 'darkest Peru', female Pacha and her brother Mateo are the first twin Andean bears born in Britain.

item.title: From opulence to obscurity: What a difference a year makes for royal weddings
item.description: The atmosphere was electric as Prince Harry and Meghan Markle married in May 2018 in the grand St George's Chapel in the Castle. Princess Beatrice's wedding was low-key.

item.title: RICHARD KAY: The Duke of York is so diminished he dare not even be seen giving his own daughter away
item.description: RICHARD KAY: There is nothing quite as romantic as the phrase 'summer bride' and so it is hard to believe that Princess Beatrice was yesterday married in a ceremony of such secrecy.

item.title: Flight risk! Brazil's president Jair Bolsonaro feeds big birds for the second time in a week
item.description: Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro, 65, tested positive for Covid-19 last Tuesday, after coming down with a fever, and remains quarantined in the Palácio da Alvorada in Brazil.

item.title: Emergency lockdown in Leicestershire to be lifted this weekend but city centre to stay shut
item.description: The local lockdown will be lifted in parts of Leicestershire as soon as this weekend following a review by public health experts, the Government has said.

item.title: Coronavirus: Bollywood star Aishwarya Rai admitted to hospital
item.description: The Bollywood actress, 46, had been isolating at home with her daughter Aaradhya, eight, but they are both now being treated at a Mumbai hospital.

item.title: Security firm G4S to pay £44m+ after overcharging government
item.description: The UK's Serious Fraud Office (SFO) and G4S agreed a fine of more than £38.5 million and costs of £5.9 million after a probe found three counts of fraud.

item.title: Britain's best and worst seaside locations named with St Mawes in Cornwall top and Skegness bottom
item.description: The consumer group asked holidaymakers to rate recent visits to over 100 UK seaside resorts across a range of factors including food and drink, seafront, beach, and peace and quiet.

item.title: Mick Jagger's ex Luciana Morad tells JAN MOIR about why Jerry Hall never forgave her
item.description: JAN MOIR: Adjust your eyeballs and drink in the glory. Ask yourself this. Is there anyone more fabulous at 50 than Brazilian bombshell Luciana Gimenez Morad?

item.title: Taking hormone replacement therapy to cope with the menopause 'cuts risk of common infections'
item.description: Researchers from the University of Texas, in Dallas, found that women who take hormone replacement therapy are less at risk of contracting urinary tract infections

item.title: German man on run for five days after disarming police arrested
item.description: German police today announced Yves Rausch, 31, has been arrested after a five-day man hunt in the forest to find him. He disarmed officers after they carried out an ID check on him.

item.title: Dog beaten, tied in plastic bag and dumped in river SURVIVES
item.description: The three dogs, all Spanish sighthounds, were found by two bike riders in the area known as Gil Gomez de Arahal, in the province of Seville, in the southern Spanish region of Andalusia.

item.title: BEL MOONEY: Is it worth having a baby with my vile husband?
item.description: This week Bel advises a reader who is considering whether or not to have a baby with her partner after he cheated. She says he never said sorry for straying and 'tells her off all the time'.

item.title: Is Ed Sheeran the new Banksy? Artworks turn up around singer's Suffolk town - and look VERY familiar
item.description: Rumours are flying that pop star Ed Sheeran is behind mystery artiworks being left round East Suffolk. The anonymous painter known as The Hat has been donating paintings during lockdown.

item.title: Street photos show New Yorkers' private text messages
item.description: Jeff Mermelstein, 63, from Brooklyn, has been using his iPhone to snap photos of strangers' cellphone screens on the street since October 2017.

item.title: How 'grand-nannying' duties drive a wedge between older couples
item.description: For many older couples, looking after the grandchildren together is one of their greatest pleasures. But for some it's nothing more than a source of marital strife, research shows.

item.title: Boris Johnson pictured with rescue dog Dilyn by his side and meeting key figures for COVID-19 talks
item.description: It's been a tumultuous year in Downing Street since Boris Johnson became Prime Minister last July - but throughout much of it devoted Dilyn the Jack Russell has been by his side.

item.title: Budapest's amazing Memento Park is full of statues of Communist leaders from Lenin to Che Guevara
item.description: They didn't chuck communist-era statues in the river in most former Soviet countries after the Iron Curtain fell. Instead, they put them in museums like Memento Park, writes Malcolm Tattersall.

item.title: There's no music scene... but there's still plenty to rave about on a Tui holiday in Ibiza
item.description: The Daily Mail's Mark Porter was among those on the first Tui flights to Ibiza since travel restrictions were lifted. He found that the beaches there were peaceful and the raves had gone.

item.title: Madeleine McCann: Suspect's 'girlfriend' accomplice revealed
item.description: Christian Brueckner's alleged ex-girlfriend was finally unmasked last night - sparking hope she could unravel the mystery of the Madeline McCann's disappearance.

item.title: How green is your fake lawn? Sales soared during lockdown but critics say they're bad for wildlife
item.description: Experts say the decline in urban butterflies and urban bees in Britain is down to artificial lawns. The country's biggest suppliers say business has been booming during lockdown.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein's victim Maria Farmer claims it was the British socialite who always set the trap
item.description: For talented young artist Maria Farmer, it was the night she'd been working towards for months - her graduation show at the prestigious New York Academy of Art.

item.title: Why a solo holiday to Turkey is a gloriously sociable - and affordable - way to travel
item.description: Until she arrived in Bodrum, Turkey, Liz Hoggard had never been on a singles holiday and had been nervous about a group trip with strangers. But she found that she needn't have worried.

item.title: Officer is suspended after shocking footage showed handcuffed black man yelling 'get off my neck'
item.description: The footage was captured by an unnamed witness in Islington, London, yesterday evening and has since been circulated widely on social media. The police officer has been suspended.

item.title: Christian Brueckner's lawyer says charges against Madeleine McCann suspect are 'unlikely'
item.description: Christian Brueckner's lawyer Friedrich Fulscher said he has not been told what evidence German prosecutors have against his client and charges against the suspect are unlikely.

item.title: Chef Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall adds voice to campaign to ban junk food adverts on TV before 9pm
item.description: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall has added his voice to the campaign to ban junk food adverts on TV before 9pm. The television chef is urging Prime Minister Boris Johnson to take action.

item.title: Fashion retailer Boohoo writes to the Government to ask it to take action against exploitation
item.description: The move comes as more than £1 billion was wiped from Boohoo's share value in two days when an article claimed workers at a Leicester factory were making clothes for Boohoo for £3.50-an-hour.

item.title: Those who trust others may live longer than suspicious people
item.description: Forget having a healthy dose of cynicism - trusting others could add years to your life, a study suggests. Men and women who believe in the kindness of strangers are likely to live longer.

item.title: Those who trust others may live longer than suspicious people
item.description: Forget having a healthy dose of cynicism - trusting others could add years to your life, a study suggests. Men and women who believe in the kindness of strangers are likely to live longer.

item.title: Pair collect 20,000 bin bags of litter during their mission to walk the coast of Britain
item.description: When Wayne Dixon set out on a mission to walk the coast of Britain collecting litter with his dog, he was regarded as a bit of an oddball.

item.title: Marcel Marceau's greatest performance was to use skills to save Jewish children from the Nazis
item.description: Marcel Marceau personally smuggled at least 70 youngsters out of France and across the Alps to Switzerland, rescuing them from almost certain slaughter in the concentration camps.

item.title: Social distancing to continue for a long time, says Chris Whitty
item.description: Social distancing may be necessary for a long time, England's top medic Professor Chris Whitty has said after the Prime Minister said he hoped to ease the one-metre rule by November.

item.title: Police release E-fit of hired hitman who shot Bolton gymgoer
item.description: Greater Manchester Police are appealing for help in identifying a gunman who tried to assassinate a man outside a gym in Bolton, after detectives released an e-fit image of the suspect.

item.title: WindowSwap site lets you browse window views from around world
item.description: The videos, which are pre-recorded, take onlookers across a pretty diverse journey and include vantages from a rooftop in Istanbul to a breezy open-air view of a boardwalk in Okinawa.

item.title: Lines of up to two hours long form as Benidorm makes people reserve a place on the beach
item.description: Holidaymakers faced having to queue to make their beach reservation on Friday for the first time in the famous resort's history following the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Ask Italian and Zizzi cut 75 restaurants and 1,200 jobs
item.description: The Azzurri Group, which owns the chains, said the Covid-19 crisis had had 'a profound impact on the casual dining sector, bringing many businesses like ours to a standstill'.

item.title: Pentagon awards firm contract to build mini space station
item.description: The Pentagon has awarded aerospace firm Sierra Nevada a contract to build a mini space station. The company will transform its Shooting Star craft into the orbital outpost.

item.title: Amber Heard recorded friend slamming Johnny Depp lawyer
item.description: Laura Divenere, who furnished the ex-couple's Los Angeles penthouse, said in her witness statement she never saw Heard with any injuries following a fight with Depp in May 2016.

item.title: Child psychology experts share ultimate teenager parenting tips
item.description: The authors of a new book entitled What's My Teenager Thinking? Practical Child Psychology have shared their top tips for dealing with common parenting issues.

item.title: Huawei reveals plans to open three stores on UK high streets
item.description: The Chinese technology giant is planning to open three stores in London and Manchester creating 100 jobs as part of a £10 million investment by their consumer division, despite this week's snub.

item.title: Princess Beatrice marries in secret Windsor Castle ceremony
item.description: Princess Beatrice has married Italian property developer Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi in secret at Windsor Castle. The couple were due to tie the knot at the Chapel Royal of St James's Palace In May.

item.title: Countries with male leaders have had 4.3 TIMES more Covid-19 deaths
item.description: Experts led by Trinity College Dublin analysed outbreaks in 35 countries, 10 of which were run by women. Male-led countries had six times more Covid-19 deaths than nations with women in power.

item.title: UK's first acid attack killer gets 17 years' jail as appeal bid fails
item.description: Xeneral Webster (pictured), now 21, from Westway, west London, asked three appeal judges to let him challenge his manslaughter conviction.

item.title: Parents of Ghislaine Maxwell's 'lieutenant' fear for daughter
item.description: Sarah Kellen worked as Jeffrey Epstein's personal assistant for around 10 years. She is accused of playing a pivotal role in Epstein's empire, acting as a 'lieutenant' to Ghislaine Maxwell.

item.title: Dara Huang, Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi's glamorous ex-fiancee
item.description: Before marrying Beatrice, Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi was engaged to Dara Huang, a very glamorous American architect with her own design company and lives in west London.

item.title: Princess Beatrice weds Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi after dating Paolo Liuzzo and Dave Clark
item.description: Princess Beatrice has married Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi in secret, over three years after she split with her partner of 10 years Dave Clark and after breaking up with first love Paolo Liuzzo in 2006.

item.title: Carjackers punch woman to ground before fleeing in her BMW
item.description: Three carjackers attacked a woman in her 30s at around 3.20pm on July 3 in Solihull, West Midlands. Shocking footage shows them knock the woman to the ground before fleeing in her BMW X5.

item.title: Private girls' school in Dorset once attended by Camilla's daughter plunges into administration
item.description: St Mary's Shaftesbury, a Roman Catholic boarding and day school in Dorset, shut permanently on Wednesday after the deal broke down one day before contracts were due to be exchanged.

item.title: Royal Scots Dragoon Guards Captain dismissed after sex attack
item.description: Captain Dominic Moore, 30, attacked the woman at a formal Army dinner being hosted by fellow officers from the Scotland-based Royal Scots Dragoon Guards.

item.title: Closing speeches heard in PC Andrew Harper's murder trial
item.description: Henry Long, 19, pictured, was driving a Seat Toledo on August 15 last year while part of a gang stealing a quad bike in Berkshire on the night Pc Andrew Harper was dragged to his death.

item.title: UK motorways packed as school holidays start on hot weekend
item.description: Motorways heading southbound towards Cornwall, South Devon and Plymouth, have pilled up with traffic as many families set off on summer holidays ahead of the scorching weekend.

item.title: World Emoji Day: Apple previews iOS 14 Memoji designs
item.description: To celebrate World Emoji Day today, Apple CEO Tim Cook revealed a short animation of the upcoming Memoji for iOS 14, coming this autumn.

item.title: Stacey Giggs had £10k designer gear stolen while at concert
item.description: The ex-wife of Ryan Giggs, 41, was at a The Wanted gig at the Abode Hotel in Manchester when she was targeted by the burglar who was a 'big fan' of the singer on February 28.

item.title: Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant struggle with Scouse accent
item.description: Researchers from UK price comparison site Uswitch have warned that the smart devices are left flummoxed by more than 23 per cent of regional accents.

item.title: Frontline nurse Cohan Zarnoch's photos of remote African tribes
item.description: American photographer and nurse Cohan Zarnoch, 54, has worked with multiple non-profit organisations over the past 12 years snapping breathtaking pictures of rural tribes.

item.title: Thirsty squirrel BEGS child for water - and finishes off the bottle
item.description: A parched squirrel polished off a bottle of water in one long gulp. In astonishing footage, the squirrel runs after a child and stands on its hind legs, stretching out its front paws to beg for the bottle.

item.title: Coronavirus: Over-65 death risk 18k times higher than under-20
item.description: Epidemiologists from Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health studied data from Geneva, Switzerland to calculate the likelihood of dying from COVID-19.

item.title: Viking re-enactor nearly kills partner when he stabs her with sword while practising his moves
item.description: An unnamed woman sustained a life-threatening injury after she was stabbed by a Viking re-enactor on the grounds of the Woolpack Inn (pictured) in Benover, near Maidstone, Kent.

item.title: Two men in 20s dead after car hits road barrier in police chase
item.description: The Independent Office for Police Conduct has begun an investigation after two men were killed when their car crashed into a road barrier in Brighouse, West Yorkshire, during a police pursuit.

item.title: 'Baby killer' ex-lover who stabbed pregnant woman and her unborn child to death is jailed for life
item.description: 'Pure evil' Aaron McKenzie has been jailed for life at the Old Bailey in London for stabbing his heavily pregnant ex-girlfriend Kelly Fauvrelle and their unborn baby to death.

item.title: Queen Maxima of the Netherlands dons a white suit for family portrait
item.description: Queen Maxima, 49, posed with her husband King Willem-Alexander, 53, and their daughtersjoked and laughed as they posed in the stunning garden of Paleis Huis ten Bosch in The Hague.

item.title: Ben Fogle's New Lives in the Wild is hit with a second tragedy
item.description: Fogle expressed sorrow over the news that Chris Clark, who was born in Scotland but had featured on New Lives in the Wild while living in a remote part of the Amazon had died of cancer aged 59.

item.title: Postman helps teacher decide front door colour via note
item.description: Elizabeth Pocklington, a science teacher from Nottingham, was struggling to choose a colour and had painted several swatches on her front door ranging from cream to green.

item.title: Photo shows Amber Heard's face after Johnny Depp 'threw phone'
item.description: Ms Heard's photograph shows redness on her right cheek and eye but the images were written off by Mr Depp's lifelong friend Isaac Baruch as 'phoney baloney' at the High Court.

item.title: News anchor keeps her cool as she loses a TOOTH live on air, catches it and carries on
item.description: Marichka Padalko, a Ukrainian news presenter on the TSN channel, kept her composure and moved her right hand to her mouth to catch the tooth without pausing in her newscast.

item.title: Women in their 70s are more likely to have a husband today than a decade ago
item.description: Just 50 per cent of adults over the age of 16 in England and Wales were married or in a civil partnership in 2019, according to the Office for National Statistics.

item.title: Police sergeant, 29, 'tried to secretly film female colleague in the shower'
item.description: Det Sgt. Benjamin McNish, 29, from Benfleet, Essex, allegedly trained his iPhone on the female officer through the shower door.

item.title: Barcelona in 'voluntary lockdown': City's residents urged to stay home after coronavirus case spike
item.description: But the regional government stopped short of imposing a mandatory lockdown for Spain's second-largest city and said the measures were meant to avoid having to do so.

item.title: Ireland to EXCLUDE Britain from its list of quarantine-free countries
item.description: Britons arriving in Ireland will have to self-isolate for 14 days even after a 'green list' of quarantine free-countries is published on Monday, and despite rules for Irish tourists being dropped on July 3.

item.title: YouTuber 'threatened to cut off Tommy Robinson's head'
item.description: Muhammad Abdul Basir 24, from Mitcham, south London, is accused of posting videos online threatening the former EDL leader Tommy Robinson and causing him fear, on two occasions last year.

item.title: This Morning viewers left heartbroken by five-year-old boy whose local produce stall was robbed
item.description: Harry Clare, five, from Worcestershire, was left distraught this week after discovering his stall's produce, as well as the honesty box used by customers, had been ransacked overnight.

item.title: Kitemark launched for face coverings
item.description: Masks or some form of face covering will be mandatory in shops in England from July 24 to help tackle the spread of coronavirus.

item.title: Outrage at video of poor Indian couple being beaten and forcibly evicted by police
item.description: A lower-caste Dalit couple in India attempted suicide after police beat them and destroyed their crops, triggering calls yesterday for an end to brutal evictions of poor minorities.

item.title: Catherine Deneuve's grandson arrested over Mafia counterfeits
item.description: Igor Vadim, 32, was on Friday in custody in a secure police station in Paris, where he grew up in one of the most famous celebrity families in France.

item.title: Boy, 10, dies after suffering serious injuries when he fell down hole on building site
item.description: The youngster was discovered near a housing estate in Drumchapel, Scotland, just before 10pm. He has since been named locally as Shea Ryan (pictured).

item.title: Hunt for ex-boyfriend as woman's body found in fridge in Brazil
item.description: Elisângela Vespermann's lifeless body was found inside a refrigerator at her apartment in Belo Horizonte, Brazil, on Wednesday. Police are looking for her 26-year-old ex-boyfriend.

item.title: Cadbury is shrinking the size of FOUR of its chocolate bars - but isn't reducing the price
item.description: The move is an attempt by the confectionary giant to tackle obesity, with the new size meaning the multipack bars contain less than 200 calories - however the price will remain the same.

item.title: Hyksos people who usurped Ancient Egyptian pharaohs were NOT invaders
item.description: Scientists now believe the Hyksos were not an invading force, dispelling the traditional narrative. Instead, they say they moved there centuries before rising to power.

item.title: Five Brits are cleared over death of Benidorm balcony plunge girl Kirsty Maxwell
item.description: Kirsty Maxwell fell to her death on April 29 2017 after she entered the wrong room in Apartamentos Payma in Benidorm, Spain. Five men were partying in the room at the time.

item.title: Mother who breastfed her daughters in public until they were four and seven hits back at critics
item.description: Sophie Mei Lan, 32, from Wakefield breastfed her daughters, Arianna, now five, and Jasmine, now eight, in public until last year despite being told to 'put it away' and that it was 'child cruelty.'
